HexGuide.title: Hexagonal Guide
HexGuide.generalDesc: On a hexagonal grid, pieces move along 3 main axes (6 directions) instead of 2.
HexGuide.pawnDesc: Moves 1 hex forward. Captures to the 2 hexes diagonally forward (same color hexes).
HexGuide.rookDesc: Moves any distance in 6 orthogonal directions (through hex sides).
HexGuide.bishopDesc: Moves any distance in 6 diagonal directions (through hex corners).
HexGuide.knightDesc: L-shape: 2 steps orthogonally then 1 step 60° (jumps over others).
HexGuide.kingDesc: Moves 1 step in any of the 12 directions (6 orthogonal + 6 diagonal).
HexGuide.queenDesc: Combines Rook and Bishop movement (12 directions total).
HexGuide.note: Note: This editor follows axial coordinate logic. Actual movement depends on your custom logic or selected variant (e.g. Glinski vs McCooey).

seoContent.heading: Experience the Next Generation of Chess Variants
seoContent.text: Join the chessperiment community and play unique chess variants online with friends or against our integrated Stockfish AI. Our platform allows you to use custom boards and piece sets designed by creators around the world. Whether you're interested in testing a new piece logic you just created or want to jump into a match with standard rules on an irregular board, our smooth multiplayer experience has you covered. Start a private match by sharing a room code, or join the lobby to find other players. With real-time move validation and advanced engine analysis, chessperiment offers a robust environment for both casual play and competitive testing of new game mechanics.

BoardEditor.title: Chess Board Editor - Design Custom Boards
BoardEditor.description: Create your own chess board layouts. Customize dimensions, colors, and starting positions. Export or play directly.

seoContent.heading: Create and Share Custom Chess Boards
seoContent.text: With the chessperiment Chess Board Editor, you can easily design custom 8x8, 10x10, or any irregular board sizes. Customize colors, create complex starting positions, and share your creations with the world. Whether you are building a classic chess variant, exploring fairy chess concepts, or designing creative chess puzzles, our grid-based editor provides the flexibility you need. Define playable areas, block squares to create obstacles, and test your new game mechanics instantly in your browser. Our platform supports advanced board configurations that go beyond the standard grid, allowing for truly unique strategic battlefields.

ProjectView.title: Project Overview | custom chessperiment
ProjectView.description: View and manage your chess project. Edit your board and pieces in one place.

Marketplace.title: chessperiment Marketplace | Download Custom Chess Sets
Marketplace.description: Browse and download community-created chess boards and piece sets. Enhance your game with unique designs.

seoContent.heading: Discover and Share Custom Chess Assets
seoContent.text: The chessperiment Marketplace is the central hub for our creative community. Explore a vast collection of custom chess boards, pixel-perfect piece sets, and unique board designs shared by users worldwide. Whether you are looking for a minimalist aesthetic or a complex medieval theme, our marketplace offers a wide variety of assets to customize your chess experience. You can browse through free sets or discover premium content crafted by expert designers. Every item in the marketplace can be easily integrated into your library and used in your games. Share your own creations to build your reputation as a chess variant designer and contribute to the growing ecosystem of custom board games.

general.title: General
general.a1: The Piece Editor allows you to create custom chess pieces with unique movement patterns and logic.
general.q2: How do I save my piece?
general.a2: Click the 'Save Piece' button in the sidebar. Your piece will be saved to your current project.

moveEditor.title: Move Editor
moveEditor.a1: Use the visual grid to click squares where the piece can move relative to its position.
moveEditor.a2: Jumping moves allow the piece to leap over other pieces, like a Knight.

logicEditor.title: Logic Editor
logicEditor.a1: It's a visual scripting environment where you can define complex behaviors using blocks.
logicEditor.a2: Triggers start a logic chain when a specific event occurs, like 'onMove' or 'onCapture'.
logicEditor.a3: Yes, you can define and modify variables to create stateful pieces.
logicEditor.a4: You can move pieces, capture them, spawn new ones, or modify game state variables.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.a1: Check if you have defined any valid moves in the Move Editor or Logic Editor.
troubleshooting.a2: Ensure your blocks are connected properly and that the trigger condition is being met.

About.title: About Chessperiment
About.intro: Chessperiment (chessperiment.app) is a web platform dedicated to creating highly customizable chess variants. Unlike traditional chess websites, Chessperiment lets users design their own unique games with complete control over boards, pieces, rules, and interactions.

customBoards.title: Custom Boards
customBoards.description: Create boards in any shape and size to fit your vision.

pieceEditor.title: Advanced Piece Editor
pieceEditor.description: Design pieces with unique movements and abilities.

visualScripting.title: Visual Scripting
visualScripting.description: Drag-and-drop triggers, effects, and variables—similar to Scratch—to build complex game mechanics without coding.

variants.title: User-Created Variants
variants.description: Experiment and play your own chess variants or try out variants made by others.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Chessperiment exists to push the boundaries of chess creativity. We want everyone, from beginners to advanced users, to be able to invent, share, and play completely new chess experiences.

developer.title: About the Developer
developer.description: Chessperiment is developed by a single creator, active on Reddit and GitHub. Started just a few weeks ago, the platform has already attracted over 100 users who are exploring the endless possibilities of customizable chess.
